channel.title: No-ip issue
channel.description: How come my no-ip address doesn't work anymore, any ideas, I have searched and found nothing, I even reread the tutorial on how to set up a server several times. Is there something im missing? When I start up server and no-ip, I try to log on but it says the server is offline and clearly doesn't work unless im using the default 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0 This means no one will be able to connect to me...

item.description:
@thizzle wrote:

deathschaos9:

He already checked his port with canyouseeme.org, he said it was closed. He obviously portforwarded incorrectly or his firewall is blocking the port.

dam i hate portfowarding. -.- open your firewall and allow the port 43594

item.title: No-ip issue
item.dc:creator: @iamrock iamrock
item.description:
@iamrock wrote:

Yeah, first I went to command prompt, typed in ipconfig/all. It says my ip address is 192.168.1.104. I went into router settings, application and gaming, port forwarding, added ports 43594 both TCP and UDP with that exact address, save, exit.

Read full topic

item.title: No-ip issue
item.dc:creator: @thizzle thizzle
item.description:
@thizzle wrote:

it’s not supposed to work for the hoster. the hoster HAS to use 127.0.0.1! OTHERS have to use your no-ip. im telling ya’ ill test it on you.

Read full topic

item.title: No-ip issue
item.dc:creator: @iamrock iamrock
item.description:
@iamrock wrote:

Well see that’s the problem, im using a server compatible with Silab Client and when I type in the no-ip address that others are meant to use, it does not connect.

Read full topic

item.title: No-ip issue
item.dc:creator: @thizzle thizzle
item.description:
@thizzle wrote:

[quote=“iamrock, post:1, topic:342178”]How come my no-ip address doesn’t work anymore, any ideas, I have searched and found nothing, I even reread the tutorial on how to set up a server several times. Is there something im missing? When I start up server and no-ip, I try to log on but it says the server is offline and clearly doesn’t work unless im using the default 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0
This means no one will be able to connect to me…[/quote]

thats normal lool. the thing is make sure you got a client that connects to 127.0.0.1, then have a client that connects to your no-ip, it doesnt matter if it wont connect and say “error connecting to server…” just use the one with 127.0.0.1 and release the other one that connects to your no-ip. if you want ill test with you, just message me.

Read full topic

item.title: No-ip issue

item.title: No-ip issue
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“iamrock, post:1, topic:342178”]How come my no-ip address doesn’t work anymore, any ideas, I have searched and found nothing, I even reread the tutorial on how to set up a server several times. Is there something im missing? When I start up server and no-ip, I try to log on but it says the server is offline and clearly doesn’t work unless im using the default 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0
This means no one will be able to connect to me…[/quote]
You will always have to log in using localhost, but that doesn’t mean someone using your no-ip wont be able to log in, go to canyouseeme.org while your server is running and check the port.

Read full topic

item.title: No-ip issue
item.dc:creator: @iamrock iamrock
item.description:
@iamrock wrote:

How come my no-ip address doesn’t work anymore, any ideas, I have searched and found nothing, I even reread the tutorial on how to set up a server several times. Is there something im missing? When I start up server and no-ip, I try to log on but it says the server is offline and clearly doesn’t work unless im using the default 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0
This means no one will be able to connect to me…
